description: Kindergarten Coding - Fun with Sequences and Patterns

project_templates.tagline: Make the animals dance in order!
project_templates.what_kids_build: Animals that dance in a specific order
project_templates.why_exciting: Dancing animals + music = pure joy for 5-year-olds

phase_1_rule_teaching.intro_hook: The animals want to have a dance party! But they need to know WHAT ORDER to dance in. Can you tell them?

teaching_script.gigi_says: A SEQUENCE is steps in order. First, then, next, last!
teaching_script.voice_text: First the cat jumps! Then the dog spins! Next the bunny hops! That's a sequence - steps in ORDER!

rule_card.title: Sequences
rule_card.rule: A sequence is steps in order: First â†’ Then â†’ Next â†’ Last
rule_card.example: First wake up, then brush teeth, next eat breakfast!

challenges.prompt:
Drag the animals into the RIGHT order:

1. Cat jumps
2. ___
3. ___
4. Everyone dances!

tier1.teach: Look at the numbers! 1, 2, 3, 4 - put them in counting order!

challenges.prompt: Cat jumped. Dog spun. What comes NEXT?

phase_6_complete.celebration: The animals had an AMAZING dance party! You're a sequence superstar!

project_templates.why_exciting: Making pretty patterns feels like art + coding

phase_1_rule_teaching.intro_hook: Let's make a beautiful necklace for the princess! We need a PATTERN - colors that repeat!

teaching_script.gigi_says: A PATTERN repeats! Red, Blue, Red, Blue... what comes next?
teaching_script.voice_text: Red, blue, red, blue... the pattern REPEATS! So next is RED!

rule_card.title: Patterns
rule_card.rule: A pattern is something that REPEATS in the same order

tier1.teach: Red, blue, red, blue, red... the pattern goes back to BLUE!

challenges.prompt: Create an ABC pattern using animals!

phase_6_complete.celebration: You made beautiful patterns! The princess loves her necklace!

project_templates.tagline: Tell the robot exactly what to do!
project_templates.why_exciting: Being the boss of a robot is empowering

phase_1_rule_teaching.intro_hook: This robot wants to help you, but it only does EXACTLY what you tell it! Can you give good instructions?

teaching_script.gigi_says: Robots need CLEAR instructions. Not 'go there' - say 'move forward 3 steps'!
teaching_script.voice_text: Robots can't think! You must tell them EXACTLY what to do, step by step!

rule_card.title: Clear Instructions
rule_card.rule: Good instructions are: 1) Specific 2) In order 3) One step at a time
rule_card.example: Move 2 steps, turn left, move 1 step

challenges.prompt:
Robot is 3 squares from cookie. What commands?

Robot needs to turn! Write the steps.

phase_6_complete.celebration: Your robot followed every instruction! You're a great robot commander!

project_templates.tagline: Can you follow the cat's instructions?
project_templates.what_kids_build: Execute instructions to reach a goal
project_templates.why_exciting: Following a cute cat on an adventure

phase_1_rule_teaching.intro_hook: The cat knows where the treasure is! But you have to follow its instructions EXACTLY. Ready?

teaching_script.gigi_says: Following instructions means doing EXACTLY what it says, in ORDER!
teaching_script.voice_text: Jump two times - one, two! Spin around - wheee! Touch your nose - boop! You followed the instructions!

challenges.prompt: Cat says: Go right 2, Go up 1, Go right 1. Where do you end up?

phase_6_complete.celebration: You found the treasure by following instructions perfectly!

project_templates.tagline: Something's wrong! Can you fix it?
project_templates.what_kids_build: Find and fix mistakes in sequences
project_templates.why_exciting: Finding mistakes makes kids feel clever

phase_1_rule_teaching.intro_hook: Oh no! The story is all mixed up! The dog is eating BEFORE he wakes up! Can you find what's wrong?

teaching_script.gigi_says: A BUG is when something is wrong or in the wrong place. Let's find it!
teaching_script.voice_text: Wait! You can't eat breakfast BEFORE waking up! That's the bug! Let's fix it!

rule_card.title: Finding Bugs
rule_card.rule: A bug is something wrong. To fix it: 1) Look carefully 2) Find what's wrong 3) Fix it!
rule_card.example: Wrong order? Move the step to the right place!

challenges.prompt: What's wrong? Put on shoes â†’ Put on socks â†’ Go outside
What's wrong? Eat the cookie â†’ Mix ingredients â†’ Bake in oven
challenges.answer: You can't eat it before making it!

phase_6_complete.celebration: You fixed all the bugs! You're a debugging detective!

summary.theme_consistency: All projects use animals, colors, simple characters - perfect for 5-year-olds
summary.no_reading_required: All activities use pictures, drag-drop, and voice instructions
summary.unplugged_friendly: Can be done with cards, toys, or on screen
